Module jakarta.mvc
Package jakarta.mvc.form

Class FormMethodOverwriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • jakarta.mvc.form.FormMethodOverwriter
  • public final class FormMethodOverwriter
extends Object

    Form method overwriter is used to overwrite a HTML form's HTTP method to be able to use other verbs such as PATCH or DELETE.

    Since:
    2.1
    Author:
    Tobias Erdle

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  FormMethodOverwriter.Options
      Options for property FORM_METHOD_OVERWRITE.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static String DEFAULT_HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME
      The default name of the hidden form field used to overwrite the HTTP method.
      static String FORM_METHOD_OVERWRITE
      Property that can be used to enable the Form method overwrite mechanism for an application.
      static String HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME
      Property that can be used to configure the name of the hidden form input to get the targeted HTTP method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FormMethodOverwriter()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • FORM_METHOD_OVERWRITE

        public static final String FORM_METHOD_OVERWRITE
        Property that can be used to enable the Form method overwrite mechanism for an application. Values of this property must be of type FormMethodOverwriter.Options.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME

        public static final String HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME
        Property that can be used to configure the name of the hidden form input to get the targeted HTTP method.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME

        public static final String DEFAULT_HIDDEN_FIELD_NAME
        The default name of the hidden form field used to overwrite the HTTP method.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
